ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Insight into my classmates works through discussion

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Its major strength is that all Art majors are put into a room together for two hours. Its weakness is that it was not successful in effectively utilizing people's talents and expression.

I think that this course was very strong. The topics and materials chosen by Prof. Schneider each week were engaging and unique, and our class discussions often involved individual opinions and thoughts that all together broadened my understanding of art both historically and personally. The readings and discussions pushed me out of my comfort zone and gave me new perspectives that I enjoyed experimenting with and implementing into my work for the weekly class response assignments.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: As a requirement for the art major, I'd only recommend it because of the audience it attracts.
